Search results

osc-handle

Add a handle fn (a method in OSC parlance) to the specified OSC path (container). This handle will be called when an incoming OSC message matches the supplied path. This may either be a direct match, or a pattern match if the incoming OSC message uses wild card chars in its path. The path you specify may not contain any of the OSC reserved chars: # * , ? [ ] { } and whitespace Will override and remove any handler already associated with the supplied path. If the handler-fn returns :done it will automatically remove itself.

File: overtone/osc.clj Line: 60 

      (defn osc-handle
  "Add a handle fn (a method in OSC parlance) to the specified OSC path
  (container). This handle will be called when an incoming OSC message matches
  the supplied path. This may either be a direct match, or a pattern match if
  the incoming OSC message uses wild card chars in its path.  The path you
  specify may not contain any of the OSC reserved chars:
  # * , ? [ ] { } and whitespace

  Will override and remove any handler already associated with the supplied
  path. If the handler-fn returns :done it will automatically remove itself."
  [peer path handler]
  (peer-handle peer path  handler)
  peer)
